item.text: Jethro, the priest of Midian, Moses’ father-in-law, heard about all that God had done for Moses and for his people Israel, that the Lord had brought Israel out of Egypt.
Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, took Moses’ wife Zipporah after he had sent her back,

and her <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st>, <st data-num="0259" class="">one</st> of <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> was <st data-num="08034" class="">named</st> <st data-num="01647" class="">Gershom</st><n id="1" /> (<st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> Moses<n id="2" /> had <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “I have <st data-num="01961" class="">been</st> a <st data-num="01616" class="">foreigner</st><n id="3" /> in a <st data-num="05237" class="">foreign</st> <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st>”)
and the other Eliezer (for Moses had said, “The God of my father has been my help and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh”).
Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, together with Moses’ sons and his wife, came to Moses in the wilderness where he was camping by the mountain of God.

He <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st>, “<st data-num="0589" class="">I</st>, your <st data-num="02859" class="">father-in-law</st> <st data-num="03503" class="">Jethro</st>, am <st data-num="0935" class="">coming</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you, along with your <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st> and her <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> her.”

<st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">went out</st> to <st data-num="07125" class="">meet</st> his <st data-num="02859" class="">father-in-law</st> and <st data-num="07812" class="">bowed down</st> and <st data-num="05401" class="">kissed</st> him;<n id="1" /> they <st data-num="0376" class="">each</st> <st data-num="07592" class="">asked</st> about the <st data-num="07453" class="">other’s</st> <st data-num="07965" class="">welfare</st>, and then they <st data-num="0935" class="">went into</st> the <st data-num="0168" class="">tent</st>.
Moses told his father-in-law all that the Lord had done to Pharaoh and to Egypt for Israel’s sake, and all the hardship that had come on them along the way, and how the Lord had delivered them.
Jethro rejoiced because of all the good that the Lord had done for Israel, whom he had delivered from the hand of Egypt.
Jethro said, “Blessed be the Lord who has delivered you from the hand of Egypt, and from the hand of Pharaoh, who has delivered the people from the Egyptians’ control!
Now I know that the Lord is greater than all the gods, for in the thing in which they dealt proudly against them he has destroyed them.”
Then Jethro, Moses’ father-in-law, brought a burnt offering and sacrifices for God, and Aaron and all the elders of Israel came to eat food with the father-in-law of Moses before God.
On the next day Moses sat to judge the people, and the people stood around Moses from morning until evening.

When Moses’ father-in-law saw all that he was doing for the people, he said, “What is this that you are doing for the people? Why are you sitting by yourself, and all the people stand around you from morning until evening?”
Moses said to his father-in-law, “Because the people come to me to inquire of God.
When they have a dispute, it comes to me and I decide between a man and his neighbor, and I make known the decrees of God and his laws.”
Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “What you are doing is not good!

You will <st data-num="05034" class="">surely</st> <st data-num="05034" class="">wear out</st>,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01571" class="">both</st> <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">and</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">these</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> are <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> you, <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> this is too<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03515" class="">heavy</st> a <st data-num="01697" class="">burden</st><n id="3" /> <st data-num="04480" class="">for</st> you; you are <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03201" class="">able</st> to <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> it <st data-num="0910" class="">by</st> yourself.

<st data-num="06258" class="">Now</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">listen</st> to <st data-num="06963" class="">me</st>,<n id="1" /> I will <st data-num="03289">give</st> you <st data-num="03289" class="">advice</st>, and may <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> you. <st data-num="0859" class="">You</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> a <st data-num="04136" class="">representative</st> for the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> to <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st><n id="3" /> their <st data-num="01697" class="">disputes</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0430">God</st>;

<st data-num="02094" class="">warn</st><n id="1" /> them of the <st data-num="02706" class="">statutes</st> and the <st data-num="08451" class="">laws</st>, and <st data-num="03045" class="">make known</st> to them the <st data-num="01870" class="">way</st> in which they must <st data-num="01980" class="">walk</st><n id="2" /> and the <st data-num="04639" class="">work</st> they must <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st>.<n id="3" />

But <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="02372" class="">choose</st><n id="1" /> from the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> <st data-num="02428" class="">capable</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03373 0430" class="">God-fearing</st> men,<n id="3" /> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> of <st data-num="0571" class="">truth</st>,<n id="4" /> those who <st data-num="08130" class="">hate</st> <st data-num="01215" class="">bribes</st>,<n id="5" /> and <st data-num="07760" class="">put</st> them <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> the people<n id="6" /> as <st data-num="08269" class="">rulers</st><n id="7" /> of <st data-num="0505" class="">thousands</st>, <st data-num="08269" class="">rulers</st> of <st data-num="03967" class="">hundreds</st>, <st data-num="08269" class="">rulers</st> of <st data-num="02572" class="">fifties</st>, and <st data-num="08269" class="">rulers</st> of <st data-num="06235" class="">tens</st>.

They will <st data-num="08199" class="">judge</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> under <st data-num="03605" class="">normal</st> <st data-num="06256" class="">circumstances</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="01419" class="">difficult</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">case</st><n id="3" /> they will <st data-num="0935" class="">bring</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> you, but <st data-num="03605" class="">every</st> <st data-num="06996" class="">small</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">case</st><n id="4" /> they <st data-num="01992" class="">themselves</st> will <st data-num="08199" class="">judge</st>, so that<n id="5" /> you may <st data-num="07043" class="">make</st> it <st data-num="07043" class="">easier</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">for</st> yourself,<n id="6" /> and they will <st data-num="05375" class="">bear the burden</st><n id="7" /> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> you.
If you do this thing, and God so commands you, then you will be able to endure, and all these people will be able to go home satisfied.”
Moses listened to his father-in-law and did everything he had said.

<st data-num="04872" class="">Moses</st> <st data-num="0977" class="">chose</st> <st data-num="02428" class="">capable</st> <st data-num="0582" class="">men</st> from <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st>, and he <st data-num="05414" class="">made</st> them <st data-num="07218" class="">heads</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">over</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st>, <st data-num="08269" class="">rulers</st> of <st data-num="0505" class="">thousands</st>, <st data-num="08269" class="">rulers</st> of <st data-num="03967" class="">hundreds</st>, <st data-num="08269" class="">rulers</st> of <st data-num="02572" class="">fifties</st>, and <st data-num="08269" class="">rulers</st> of <st data-num="06235" class="">tens</st>.
They judged the people under normal circumstances; the difficult cases they would bring to Moses, but every small case they would judge themselves.
Then Moses sent his father-in-law on his way, and so Jethro went to his own land.
